filters.name: Blacklist Companies
filters.aiExplanation: When encountering job postings from these companies, automatically skip them without applying. This is a hard filter - never apply to these companies regardless of other criteria. Match company names case-insensitively.
filters.placeholder: Enter company names, one per line

filters.name: Manual Apply Companies
filters.description: Companies I want to apply to manually (skip AI auto-apply)
filters.aiExplanation: Do NOT auto-apply to jobs from these companies. These are important companies where the user wants to apply manually to ensure accuracy. When encountering job postings from these companies, flag them for manual review and DO NOT submit any application automatically. Match company names case-insensitively and check for variations (e.g., 'Amazon' matches 'Amazon.com', 'AWS').
filters.placeholder: Enter company names, one per line

filters.name: Blacklist Keywords
filters.description: Keywords in job descriptions that should trigger auto-skip
filters.aiExplanation: If a job posting contains any of these keywords in the title, description, or requirements, automatically skip it. Use case-insensitive matching. Check for partial matches (e.g., 'unpaid' matches 'unpaid internship').

filters.name: Blacklist Job Titles
filters.aiExplanation: Skip job postings with these exact or similar job titles. Use case-insensitive matching and check for variations (e.g., 'Software Engineer' matches 'Senior Software Engineer').
filters.placeholder: Enter job titles, one per line

filters.name: Whitelist Companies
filters.aiExplanation: Prioritize job postings from these companies. If a job matches other criteria, these companies should be given higher priority. Still respect blacklist and other filters. Match company names case-insensitively.
filters.placeholder: Enter company names, one per line

filters.name: Whitelist Keywords
filters.description: Keywords that make a job more attractive
filters.aiExplanation: Prioritize job postings that contain these keywords. These keywords indicate desirable features (e.g., 'remote', 'flexible hours', 'startup'). Jobs with these keywords should be given higher priority.

filters.name: Minimum Salary
filters.aiExplanation: Skip job postings where the salary range is below this amount. If no salary is mentioned, you may still apply but note the missing salary information. Use the currency specified in the salary-currency filter. For salary ranges, check if the minimum of the range meets this requirement.

filters.name: Target Salary
filters.aiExplanation: This is the ideal salary you're aiming for. Use this to prioritize jobs that offer salaries closer to this target. Jobs with salaries at or above this target should be given higher priority.

filters.name: Salary Currency
filters.aiExplanation: Use this currency when evaluating salary requirements. Convert other currencies to this one if needed using current exchange rates, or note the currency mismatch if conversion is not possible.

filters.name: Preferred Locations
filters.aiExplanation: Prioritize jobs in these locations. Jobs in other locations may still be considered if they match other strong criteria, but these locations should be preferred. Match location names case-insensitively.

filters.name: Must-Have Technologies
filters.description: Technologies that must be present in the job
filters.aiExplanation: Only apply to jobs that mention at least one of these technologies in the requirements or job description. This is a hard requirement - if none are mentioned, skip the job. Check for variations and related technologies (e.g., 'JS' matches 'JavaScript', 'React' matches 'React.js').

filters.name: Deal-Breaker Technologies
filters.description: Technologies that would cause you to skip a job
filters.aiExplanation: Skip job postings that require or heavily emphasize these technologies. This is a hard filter - if a job requires expertise in these technologies, automatically skip it.

filters.name: Minimum Years of Experience
filters.aiExplanation: Skip jobs that require more years of experience than the candidate has. If the job requires 'X+ years' and candidate has X years, still apply. If it requires 'X years' and candidate has X-1, skip. Check the candidate's experience from their resume.

filters.name: Maximum Years of Experience
filters.description: Maximum years of experience required (to avoid overqualified positions)
filters.aiExplanation: Skip jobs that require significantly more experience than you have. If a job requires '10+ years' and you have 3 years, skip it as you're likely underqualified. This helps avoid applying to senior positions when you're mid-level.

filters.name: Job Level Preference
filters.aiExplanation: Only apply to jobs at these levels. Match job titles and descriptions for level indicators like 'Junior', 'Mid-level', 'Senior', 'Lead', 'Principal', 'Staff', etc.

filters.name: Must-Have Benefits
filters.aiExplanation: Only apply to jobs that mention at least one of these benefits. If none are mentioned, you may still apply but note the missing information. Common benefits include 'health insurance', 'dental', '401k', 'stock options', 'unlimited PTO', etc.

filters.name: Skip Jobs Without Salary
filters.description: Skip job postings that don't mention salary
filters.aiExplanation: If enabled, automatically skip jobs that don't provide salary information. If disabled, still apply but note the missing salary information for review. This helps avoid wasting time on jobs that may not meet salary expectations.

filters.name: Skip Contract-Only Positions
filters.aiExplanation: If enabled, skip job postings that are explicitly contract, temporary, or freelance positions. Look for keywords like 'contract', 'temporary', 'freelance', 'consultant' in the job type or description.

filters.name: Nice-to-Have Technologies
filters.description: Technologies that are preferred but not required
filters.aiExplanation: Prioritize jobs that mention these technologies. These are bonus points - jobs with these technologies should be given higher priority, but jobs without them can still be considered.

filters.name: Company Size Preference
filters.aiExplanation: Prioritize jobs from companies of these sizes. If a job doesn't specify company size, you may still apply. 'Startup' typically means <50 employees, 'Small' is 50-200, 'Medium' is 200-1000, 'Large' is 1000+.

filters.name: Blacklist Locations
filters.aiExplanation: Skip job postings that are located in these areas. Match location names case-insensitively. If a job mentions multiple locations and one is blacklisted, skip it.

filters.name: Work Type Preference
filters.aiExplanation: Only apply to jobs that match at least one of these work types. If a job doesn't specify, you may still apply but note the missing information. 'Remote' means fully remote, 'hybrid' means partial remote, 'onsite' means office-based.

filters.name: Require Detailed Job Description
filters.description: Skip jobs with very short or vague descriptions
filters.aiExplanation: If enabled, skip job postings that have very short descriptions (less than 100 words) or are too vague. This helps avoid low-quality job postings that may be scams or poorly defined roles.

filters.name: Auto-Apply Enabled
filters.aiExplanation: If enabled, automatically submit applications for jobs that pass all filters. If disabled, only collect job information and wait for manual review before applying. Use this to control whether you want fully automated or semi-automated job applications.
